create-vendor-library-text.text:
As the building blocks that make up UI Frameworks, Vendor Libraries are the first thing you should look at when creating a new design.

To create a new Vendor Library create a new folder under frontend/src/content/jcr_root/etc/vendor-libraries/. For now, lets name this folder my-first-library.

create-vendor-library-content-xml-text.text: Inside your new vendor library folder, create a file named .content.xml with the following configuration:

create-vendor-library-content-xml-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:VendorLibrary"\\n jcr:title="My First Vendor Library"\\n description="My first Vendor Library description."\\n documentationUrl=""/>

create-vendor-library-css-js-folder-text.text: Inside your vendor library folder, create two new folders, css and js. Inside of both folders, create a .content.xml file with the following configuration:

create-vendor-library-button-less-text.text: Now let's add a new css file under css named button.less and give it some button styles:

create-vendor-library-button-less-refere.text: After your stylesheet(s) has been created, add the filename to the include array under the css/.content.xml property. Additional stylesheets can be referenced by separating their filenames with a comma.

create-ui-framework-text.text:
UI Frameworks provide the backbone for rendering sites in Kestros by:

  • Determining which component view will render
  • Compiling CSS and JS from Vendor Libraries and component views

To create a new UI Framework create a new folder under frontend/src/content/jcr_root/etc/ui-frameworks/. For now, lets name this folder my-first-ui-framework.

create-ui-framework-content-xml-text.text: Inside your new UI Framework folder, create a file named .content.xml with the following configuration:

create-ui-framework-content-xml-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root xmlns:sling="http://sling.apache.org/jcr/sling/1.0"\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n xmlns:kes="http://kestros.io/kes/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:UiFramework"\\n jcr:title="My First UI Framework"\\n kes:uiFrameworkCode=""\\n kes:vendorLibraries="[]"/>

create-ui-framework-framework-code-text.text: In order to map your UI Framework to component views, a kes:uiFrameworkCode should be provided. This is generally a shorthand of the UI Framework name. For our example we'll use my-view

create-ui-framework-framework-code-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root xmlns:sling="http://sling.apache.org/jcr/sling/1.0"\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n xmlns:kes="http://kestros.io/kes/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:UiFramework"\\n jcr:title="My First UI Framework"\\n kes:uiFrameworkCode="my-view"\\n kes:vendorLibraries="[]"/>

reference-vendor-library-text.text: Vendor Libraries can be referenced in the kes:vendorLibraries property. Referenced Vendor Libraries will be compiled into the UI Frameworks CSS and JS output. Let's add the Vendor Library we created earlier:

reference-vendor-library-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root xmlns:sling="http://sling.apache.org/jcr/sling/1.0"\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n xmlns:kes="http://kestros.io/kes/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:UiFramework"\\n jcr:title="My First UI Framework"\\n kes:uiFrameworkCode="my-view"\\n kes:vendorLibraries="[my-first-library]"/>

adding-ui-framework-css-js.text: To add custom CSS and JS to a UI Framework, follow the same steps for adding CSS and JS to a Vendor Library.

add-themes-text.text: Themes provide a way to create design variations within a UI Framework. All UI Frameworks must have at least a default

add-themes-folder-text.text: Before creating any Themes, we will need to create a themes folder under your UI Framework's directory.

adding-default-theme-text.text: Under the themes folder, create a new folder named default.

adding-default-theme-xml-text.text: Under the default theme folder, create a .content.xml file with the following configuration:

adding-default-theme-xml-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:Theme"\\n jcr:title="Default Theme">\\n</jcr:root>

adding-default-theme-css-js.text: To add overridding CSS and JS to a theme, follow the same steps for adding CSS and JS to a Vendor Library.

adding-default-theme-xml-alert.text: Additional Themes can be created in the same way, but are not required.

add-filters-text.text: The final step in building a new design is to your new Vendor Library and UI Framework to content package filters, so that they can be installed to Kestros. Add the following lines to frontend/src/content/META-INF/vault/filter.xml to add them to your build:

add-filters-final-text.text: Your filter.xml file should now look something like:

add-filters-final-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<workspaceFilter version="1.0">\\n <filter root="/apps/my-site"/>\\n <filter root="/apps/my-site/install" mode="update">\\n <include pattern=".*my-site-core-bundle.*\.jar"/>\\n </filter>\\n <filter root="/etc/ui-frameworks/my-site-framework"/>\\n <filter root="/etc/ui-frameworks/my-first-ui-framework"/>\\n \\n <filter root="/etc/vendor-libraries/my-site-vendor-library"/>\\n <filter root="/etc/vendor-libraries/my-first-library"/>\\n</workspaceFilter>

set-site-theme-text.text:
To use your new UI Framework on your generated site, update the kes:theme value on your site's root configuration to your new default Theme path. Your site's configuration can be found at content/src/content/jcr_root/content/sites/my-site/.content.xml.

The updated configuration should look like:

set-site-theme-code.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\\n<jcr:root\\n xmlns:sling="http://sling.apache.org/jcr/sling/1.0"\\n xmlns:jcr="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/1.0"\\n xmlns:nt="http://www.jcp.org/jcr/nt/1.0"\\n xmlns:kes="http://kestros.io/kes/1.0"\\n jcr:primaryType="kes:Site">\\n <jcr:content\\n jcr:primaryType="nt:unstructured"\\n sling:resourceType="my-site/components/pages/my-site-base-page"\\n kes:theme="/etc/ui-frameworks/my-first-ui-framework/themes/default"\\n jcr:title="My Site">\\n </jcr:content>\\n</jcr:root>
